intro: Parietaria lusitanica, commonly known as the Iberian wallrocket, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or disturbed soils and is often found along walls and in dry areas. It produces small, yellow flowers and has hairy, lobed leaves. Parietaria lusitanica is adapted to arid environments and is considered a resilient species in its native habitat.
